column5: Started out this morning wondering about the weather, not looking good but I said lets go anyway, Randy meets me at 9am I load my stuff into his boat & off to the Baie, as we arrive it looking very dark so we decide to wait a few minutes or 30, after the thunder moves on & the rain lets up a bit, we launch the boat & off we go very little wind & nobody else around, started throwing Spinnerbaits, Swimbaits, Jerkbaits & Crankbaits with only one follow, we decide to head for the outflow at Bruce A, started throwing a small X-Rap Jerkbait & wham I'm into a 3.5lb Brown, my 1st in about 20 yrs after 1/2 an hour with nothing else I switch baits & land 3 more Browns a 1.5, 2.5 & a 6.2lber, by now the wind is blowing pretty good & we decide to head back into the Baie, as we get closer to the rock shoal we need to go around to get back to shore, we are looking at 3 footers with white caps coming off shore, man did we get wet, but it was well worth it, biggest Brown was 22 3/4" not big enough to help Team #10 out but a real nice fighter SBK Back at it tomorrow I hope come on Pike
Sure looks like a great day Richard!  Sure beat mine - went to work....looks like some tasty dinner on the way. That 6.2 is a real fatty!
that thing is a football! nice fish
Nice catches! Hope to see another report with a big Northern in it, good luck out there.    MTBF

Oh I'm trying, I've been out 5 times for Pike & have caught Bass, Carp & Browns, hopefully Pike tomorrow, Dad & I are hoping to get out if the weather isn't to bad, he's not liking High Winds & Down Pours Thanx Guys SBK
Nice Job. Those are some beautys.
Very nice !!!! I cant wait till the season opens for something around here.Pickerel opens soon, then Pike.The new boat will be here just in time  Thanks for the fish porn.
Wow nice fish, you couldn't have asked for a better set of browns.  Good job SBK!
wait till you hook into a 20+ pounder brown....keep at it ...they are there...are you fishing the spring derby?

I don't really have the boat for it, I've fished the Derbies before but my buddy sold his boat, I like Casting more than Trolling, I'm likely going to the Belwood Lion's Pike Derby the last weekend in May, I've likely been to 15 or more of them, a Buddy came in second there once with a 36.75" Pike SBK
